Detailed Description

Posix conditions

This class implements interface to posix condition variable. All errors are returned by throwing exception. 

    #include "kaapi"
    Util::Mutex     access;    // mutex to protect concurrent access to global data
    Util::Condition condition; // condition to wakeup and signal threads
    int             counter;   // counter to defined the condition on which foo call wakeup
    
    // Let us assume that foo may be call by concurrent threads.
    int foo(int value)
    {
      // Critical section
      Util::CriticalGuard critical_section(access);

      // wait for a condition until flag be true
      while (counter != value) condition.wait( access );

      // return somethhing
    }
    
    
    // Call to this function will wakeup waiting at most one thread that waits 
    // for a given value.
    void signal_waiting_thread(int value)
    {
      // Critical section
      Util::CriticalGuard critical_section(access);

      // access to the global counter variable
      counter = value;
      
      // wakeup at most one waiting threads on value 'value' 
      // (until a next call to signal_waiting_thread)
      condition.signal();
    }
    
    int main()
    {
      try {
        // initialize the library and the mutex
        Util::Init::initialize();
        access.initialize();
        condition.initialize();

        ...

        access.terminate();
        condition.terminate();
        Util::Init::terminate();

        return 0;
      } catch (const Util::PosixError& ex) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch]:" << ex.what() << std::endl;
      } catch (const Util::Exception& ex) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch]:" << ex.what() << std::endl;
      } catch (...) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch] unknown error" << std::endl;
      }
      return -1;
    }

Member Function Documentation

void Util::Condition::broadcast (  )  throw (PosixError) [inline]

Broadcast condition to all threads. If no thread is blocked for the condition this call has no effect.

Initialize a condition. Must be called before use.

Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs

void Util::Condition::signal (  )  throw (PosixError) [inline]

Signal condition to one blocked thread. If no thread is blocked for the condition this call has no effect.

bool Util::Condition::wait ( Mutex &  mutex,
const struct timespec &  abstime 
) throw (PosixError) [inline]

Absolute bounded wait for condition. The thread is blocked until the condition is signaled by a call to signal or broadcast or if the absolute specified time is reached. The mutex is automatically released and re-acquired during the call.

Parameters:
mutex The mutex protecting the condition variable.
abstime absolute time that cannot be exceeded.
Returns:
true if awaken by timeout
Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs
bool Util::Condition::wait ( Mutex &  mutex,
long  milli,
long  nano = 0 
) throw (PosixError) [inline]

Relative bounded wait for condition. The thread is blocked until the condition is signaled by a call to signal or broadcast or if the delay expires. The mutex is automatically released and re-acquired during the call.

Parameters:
mutex The mutex protecting the condition variable.
milli delay in milliseconds of timeout
nano additional delay in nanoseconds of timeout
Returns:
true if awaken by timeout
Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs
void Util::Condition::wait ( Mutex &  mutex  )  throw (PosixError) [inline]

Wait for condition. The thread is blocked until the condition is signaled by a call to signal or broadcast. The mutex is automatically released and re-acquired during the call.

Parameters:
mutex The mutex protecting the condition variable.
